segments.pli: Atha kho aññataro bhikkhu yena bhagavā … pe … ekamantaṃ nisinno kho so bhikkhu bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha … and said to him:
“Sir, they speak of this thing called ‘the world’.

segments.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, lokoti vuccatī”ti?

segments.en: “It wears away, mendicant, that’s why it’s called ‘the world’.

segments.pli: Rūpā lujjanti, cakkhuviññāṇaṃ lujjati, cakkhusamphasso lujjati, yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi lujjati … pe …
segments.en: Sights … eye consciousness … eye contact is wearing away. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also wearing away.

segments.pli: mano lujjati, dhammā lujjanti, manoviññāṇaṃ lujjati, manosamphasso lujjati, yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi lujjati.
segments.en: The mind … thoughts … mind consciousness … mind contact is wearing away. The painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also wearing away.

segments.pli: Lujjatīti kho, bhikkhu, tasmā lokoti vuccatī”ti.
segments.en: It wears away, mendicant, that’s why it’s called ‘the world’.”

sections.title: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha ……

suttaplex.blurb: The “world” consisting of six sense experience is said to be falling apart.
